Jen stopped, her shoulders slumped and with a big sigh she turned toward home. She knew what she must do. She would have to beg her mom to drive her to school. Were making fun and insulting “her” boyfriend Ron. (Wait a minute???) Jen could remember saying “The only girl that would ever go out with that “loser” Ronald Green would have to be a huge fat whale who was desperate.”

That thought caused Jen to gasp. Was she talking about herself? Was this part of the plan to humiliate her? Ron was her boyfriend and she loved him. (Oh, my God!)

At that point Ron asked if she was ready for the calculus test? Looking down at her calculus book resting on her massive thighs; Jen said of course she was.

11512.content:
Jenny stumbled towards a fence, where she leaned forward and held herself up against it. She gritted her teeth as she felt a pressure inside her begin to build up and push outwards. Her body began to swell everywhere with fat, rounding her out as her spherical belly seemed to engulf the rest of her body. Long seconds passed as Jenny felt her body turn into what was essentially a ball of fat. Her waist was as big around as she was tall and her arms and legs were line cones that tapered to her hands and feet. Her boobs were huge, as was her butt, but still small when compared to her belly, which dominated her body. Her face developed a slight second chin and some fuller cheeks, but was essentially the same.

“What the Hell?” she whispered as she looked herself over. Her clothes were taught but not undersized, which was oddly strange. “What’s happening to me?” she took a tentative step and realized she didn’t weigh anything near what she looked to. She was fat, but as light as before. “I’m a freaking beach ball,” she said in anger.

“Baba!” Jenny snarled as she looked back down the road from whence she came. Not caring how she looked Jenny stormed down the street towards the elderly woman. As she moved, with surprising speed, down the sidewalk her giant body knocked people out of her way or to the ground. It was like they had been hit with a giant air filled balloon. It took her less time to return to Baba then it had to walk away from her.

“You!” Jenny growled and grabbed the elderly woman by her collar and slammed her into the wall. “You did this to me!”

“I advised you to watch your weight,” Baba cackled.

“I weigh the same, thank you very much,” Jenny hissed back. Suddenly she stopped, her ears perking up at t a small imperceptible sound that only she seemed to hear. Her head moved ever so slightly to the side, her eyes going sideways as if she was trying to see behind her for the noise.

ffffffffrrrrrrrrtttttttttthhhhhhhhhhhhhppppppppppppppppttttttttttttt!

“Did I just let out a long, high-pitched, smelly fart?” Jenny asked with a look of utter disbelief.

“Well what did you think happens to the extra air trapped inside of a balloon of a girl?” Baba smirked at her.

“I’m going to kill you.”

“I doubt it,” Baba smiled and tapped Jenny on the nose. She lurched forward as her butt exploded with a more violent fart, surprising her. She let go of Baba as she tried to regain her balance and the old woman scarpered away.

“I’m seriously going to kill her,” Jenny restated with murder in her eyes. She began to look for her, wincing whenever she stepped to heavily.

Jennifer turned and waddled away from the table, but as she passed Lance she sneered "What's the difference between a Jew and a pizza? The pizza doesn't scream when you put it in an oven!" then chuckled at the crass, hurtful nature of her joke.

Lance gaped at her cruel joke, then said "You know, Daphne...the worst Jews are the self-hating kind."

That didn't make any sense to Jennifer...till she felt a tingling in her face...and knew something else had changed!

She waddled as fast as she could (not easy, with her body now swelled to 500 lbs) and burst into the girls restroom, and saw in the mirror...

The Daphne Zhou who was reflected back now seemed only half Asian...and the other half of her ethnicity...the larger nose an fuller lips...was obviously Jewish.

She screamed "What the FUCK? This can't keep happening! I'm like some...half Chink and half Heeb! It's..."

She felt disoriented again, and saw that her skin had taken on an aggressively yellowish tint, and her eyes - once softly rounded - now slanted like a Chinese character in a 1940's comic book. Her mouth was fuller and more voluptuously Hebrew, and her nose was bigger, with an obviously hooked appearance. She looked like...like a blending of two separate stereotypes into one. Her clothes were no longer normal, and her swollen body was now squeezed into a Japanese Schoolgirls Uniform, with a Star of David patch as the school symbol. Her hair was long and black, worn in a ponytail and bound with "Hello Kitty" hair ribbons.

"Even when Daphne insult herself, she change rike dat girl say!" she gasped...then cried out again. Her voice had a whiney "Fran Dresher" quality about it, and she seemed to only be able to speak in the third person...and with a racist parody of an Asian accent!

She tried to speak again. "Herro? Daphne Zhou say herro? What wrong wit' Daphne voice? Daphne no say rike she want to say! Daphne talk rike...rike a JOKE!" then she started to cry. The obese, cartoonish looking Chinese-Jewish girl sat down on a toilet and bawled herself sick, unable to think of any way to fix this situation.

"Are you okay, Daphne?" someone asked, and Jennifer looked up to see a girl she didn't recognize. She blotted the tears from her cheeks, then said in her whiney voice - exchanging her R's and L's like a Chinese stereotype. "Daphne Zhou so solly she make such fuss. Daphne Zhou go to crass now. Daphne Zhou so solly."

Jennifer waddled out of the restroom and to her next class. She was VERY careful to avoid saying anything to anyone if she could help it, but was mostly sure to keep an eye out for the REAL Daphne Zhou. She HAD to get through the day and find that witch Baba. If she could convince her that she'd changed, maybe Baba would reverse her changes?

14522222212.content:
Daphne's mother Beverly watched her daughter waddle towards her vehicle, and had a sudden thought that this...this behemoth couldn't be her daughter. But then...Bev also seemed different. Unaware that magical shrapnel from Baba Yusefni extremely powerful spell was affecting everyone who was closely related to her, she didn't herself realize that she'd only weighed 120 lbs a few hours ago. But as Jennifer had replaced her daughter, then swelled into a comically obese version of Daphne, Beverly Zhou's own body had grown large and rotund with fat. After all, what sort of trim, athletic woman has a daughter who weighs in at over 500 lbs? Slowly, over the course of the day, her once trim body had swollen and bloated, as more and more of Daphne's snack foods appeared in their pantry, and soon in her own hands. She was totally unaware that she'd started the day off as an exercise junkie who'd always given her plump daughter a hard time about her weight, and now thought she'd always been a glutton.

"Come on, Daphne. We're going to meet your father at the 'Golden Dragon' for dinner."

Jennifer lumbered to the windstar and tried to squeeze into the passenger seat, but simply couldn't fit. At nearly 600 lbs, she was just too big. Several nearby students jeered at this, and those who were female suddenly acquired an additional 50 lbs of fat added to their bodies. The entire cheerleading squad was now buldging out of their uniforms, plump little bellies and husky thighs jiggling as they giggled. They were utterly unaware of the change, and they went on as they were...their boyfriends arms encircling their plump waists and all of them snacking on candy bars and potato chips while they looked forwards to dinner.

Jennifer slid open the side door and dropped into the back seat, panting and tired. Beverly smiled and handed her replacement daughter a Hershey bar, saying "Here you go, honey. To keep up your strength till we eat. Right now, we've got to get home and change for dinner. You can't dine out dressed like that, after all. I'm glad you're so proud of your body, but you're practically naked in that outfit."

Jennifer was still very much a bitch, but she was grateful for the candy...and the fact that Bev hadn't made fun of her or insulted her. She said "Thanks mom." without thinking about it, and ate the chocolate in three big bites. She wanted to ask questions, but instead decided to just sit back and stay quiet. She couldn't very well start telling her that she wasn't her daughter...or this fat. It wouldn't make any sense to the woman.

They passed 'Georgio's Fruit' on the way home, and Jennifer made sure to remember exactly where the location was. After all, that was the place she'd insulted Baba Yusefni...and probably where the REAL Daphne Zhou had gone to get Jennifer cursed like this. She had to remember that location...and that awful name. "Baba Yusefni..." she said over and over again in her head "...is the one who cursed me. Baba Yusefni. Baba Yusefni. Baba Yusefni..."

Once they got home, she dressed in a loose, billowy pink muumuu, and she met her new father. Jiang Zhou was apparently from Hong Kong, meeting Beverly while in the states on business, and was now just as fat as his wife. A rotund, yet handsome Chinese fellow with a big laugh and dancing eyes, he hugged his 'daughter' and said "Well, don't you look healthy this evening! Come on, girl. the 'Golden Dragon' awaits!"

The 'Golden Dragon' was the cities best known Chinese restaurant, a huge place with just the sort of decor you'd expect. Red and gold were the dominant colors, with Golden Dragons motifs and all the gaudy "Chinese" gee-gaws and objects that always clutter-up such places. Jennifer saw their waitress, a tiny Chinese girl dressed in supposedly traditional costume, and smirked.

"Would you LOOK at this? The whole place looks so fake and over the top. And the staff all look like extras from some moronic chop-socky movie! Nothing could be as garish and fake as this...uh-oh..."

She felt it building in the pit of her stomach, and spread throughout her body. Man, when was she going to get control of her mouth! She was under a curse, after all...she KNEW she was under a curse...but she was far to used to simply speaking her mind whenever she wanted.

Finally, the feeling passed, and Jiang Zhou asked "Miss? Are you alright?" in lilting, singsong Cantonese. It was a Chinese dialect...and Jennifer had never heard it before. Despite that, she understood exactly was he'd said, and answered in the same language "I'm sorry, but I felt faint for a moment."

Jiang Zhou smiled and waved it off. "It's fine, Madame Dragon. Just have this girl show us to our table."

Jennifer looked up at the man who had become her father...and knew that he wasn't her father any more. The Zhou family didn't HAVE a daughter anymore, instead Jiang and Beverly Zhou had come alone to the 'Golden Dragon' alone...and Jennifer was just a member of the restaurants staff.

She was now dressed in a clinging, one-piece Qipao (sometimes erroneously called a Cheongsam or "Mandarin Dress") of red silk decorated with peacocks and dragons, cut tight to accentuate the globe-like shape of her figure. Her hair was now drawn back into a tight bun and held in place with red lacquered hair forks, her make-up was thick and immaculately applied - heavy foundation, blood red lipstick, blush, eye shadow and black eyeliner and mascara to accentuate her eyes. Long, red nails decorate with golden peacock symbols and a long. red lacquered cigarette holder completed her transformation into an exaggerated "Dragon Lady" archetype.

"Oh...my goodness..." she moaned in Mandarin Chinese (she now spoke several dialects of Chinese fluently), as she realized she'd changed again. The waitress took the Zhou's to their table, and a man walked up to Jennifer and asked "Tiao, are you feeling okay? I can't have you blowing off the customers. It's important that you smile, be friendly, and accentuate the diners pleasure at being here at the 'Golden Dragon', you understand? They come for the food, but also to see the bizarre character of 'Madame Dragon' that you portray. You HAVE to play the part to the hilt, you understand? No time for slacking! Get to work!"

Jennifer almost told the man (who she somehow knew was her boss) to shut up, but found that she couldn't. He had told her what to do...and she felt compelled to do exactly what he'd said. Was this part of the curse, or was he a magician as well? Instead, she smiled and said "I understand, Mister Xang. I will do just as you say. Please forgive this unworthy one for her failure. 'Madame Dragon' will not fail you again."

When the next customers entered (a Caucasian couple) she smiled and gestured with her cigarette "Ah, most welcome to the Golden Dragon, noble Amelicans! I - 'Madame Dragon' - am your hostess! Missy Tang, preese to take this most honored couple to a table and serve them well. If you have any probrems, please to tell 'Madame Dragon' and she make every'ting jus' fine!"

She was a huge, vast joke. A gaudy, fake stereotype from a B-Movie. The waddling punch-line to a racist joke. Yet...she couldn't help it. Under the gaze of Mister Xang (was he another sorcerer or something?) she felt compelled to act this way. She spoke English in that buffoonish amusing way Asians in old movies did. What was now jokingly called "Engrish", and she couldn't stop. Finally, as the night ended and 'Madame Dragon" waved goodbye to the last guests (Jiang and Beverly Zhou both left hours ago, obviously not remembering her as their daughter at all) and she was asked back into the office by Mister Xang. She was offered a bowl of General Tso's Chicken and rice, and she ate hugely...but made sure not to smudge her make-up.

"So, how are you enjoying playing the part of 'Madame Dragon', Jennifer?" he asked, obviously aware of her real identity.

Jennifer (or 'Tiao Zheng' as her new memories identified her) looked worried, and unconsciously she slipped a cigarette into the red holder, and smoked for a moment to calm her nerves. She hadn't smoked before, but now...she knew she did.

145222222122.content:
"How...how you do this to Tiao Zheng?" Jennifer asked, then gasped as she realized she'd referred to herself as Tiao Zheng and not Jennifer.

"Tiao Zheng? Tiao Zheng! My name Tiao Zheng! Why I keep saying that?"

The Asian gentleman smiled indulgently, and took one of her fat hands in his. "My, because you ARE Tiao Zheng now, my dear. I saw the rather interesting - if somewhat primitive - spell that someone had laid upon you, and on a whim...I decided to peek into your head. THIS is what I saw, Jennifer. You are a bigot. An astonishingly imaginative bigot. If you weren't such a repulsive person, I might have been tempted to offer you a position as my apprentice. But, after see the person you were...still are, in many ways...I decided instead to simply hijack you and use that fine mind of yours, after I'd sufficiently broken your spirit. You really ARE an obese, Chinese woman named Tiao Zheng. A gluttonous woman with a theatrical streak that compels her to dress and act as a buffoonish parody of her former opinions. As the altered spell runs through your soul...twisting and warping you into the perfect conduit for my magic, you will forever..."

Mister Xang had turned away from the absurd woman in the gaudy costume and makeup, smoking as she glared at him. He reached for an ornamental wand mounted on the wall. An ancient thing carved from jade during the life of the first Emperors.

And that was when Tiao Zheng raised the empty bowl over her head and struck Mister Xang on the back of the head.

With a groan, he fell over and clutched his head...and she hit him again. He dropped the wand, and a thin, greenish smoke rose from the fragments of the wand. The twisted, firmed into a serpentine shape and hissed "Who dares to shatter the First Wand? Who has broken the most ancient source of true magic?"

Mister Xang looked up, and started to scream...as the Smoke Dragon darted towards him, wrapped about him, then dissolved him. His body crumbled to dust, and a feeling of enervation filled Tiao Zheng with his spent life-force...and his magical power.

In a moment...it was over. Tiao Zheng still had Jennifer's old mind and personality, but she now also had the sort of magical power she'd need to take revenge on that bitch Daphne - who was still pretending to be her while she dated that loser and stuffed her fat face with food. And perhaps...just perhaps...she'd also be able to get revenge on Baba Yusefni. Mister Xang had said that the spell was primitive. Now that she had his magical knowledge, she knew she was more powerful than Baba Yusefni.

The cute, little Chinese girl from earlier knocked, then entered the room. She asked "Where's Mister Xang?"

Jennifer smiled, then gestured a simple spell at the girl. "There is no Mister Xang, girl..." she said in fluent Mandarin Chinese "...He never was here. I am Tiao Zheng...and I have always run the 'Golden Dragon' restaurant. Do you understand, girl?"

The girl looked confused, then smiled and nodded. "Sorry, Madame Zheng. I forgot."

Jennifer pointed at the remains of Mister Xang, and said "Sweep that mess up first, girl. I must have spilled my ashtray."

1452222221222.content:
With Xang's power, now resting inside her, Jennifer knew that her brief time at the bottom was over. Now she could get back her body, her old life, then revenge on the witch and the fatso... though why the rush?

No need to worry about tests or highschool; she now owned of one the best restaurants in town, that was behind her. She was free to do whatever she wanted. Let Baba and Daphne enjoy themselves, with the belief that they had beaten her. Let them have fun and let their guard down, thinking that the battle was won. It would just be all the sweeter when the time came... plus it would give her time to plan the revenge to a T.

Until that day, however, she would make do with her life here. "For starters" she thought, approaching the full length mirror in the corner of her (formerly Xang's) office, "I really should do something about my look." Jennifer's look was still that of Tiao Zheng; fat cliche of a woman, so a reinterpretation was deffinately in order. Now she could just zap the weight gone.. but then again, turning towards the girl as she bent over the ashes, perhaps she could just... transfer it. With that, she felt her body tingle as her fat shrunk back into her. Still clingy; the qipao no longer accentuate a globe-like shape, but showed off her slende figure. Less Madame Dragon, more a elegant phoenix rising rising from the embers. A cursorily glance over her shoulder showed the secondary effect of her spell. Jenny is a spoiled brat. She is also the most popular girl at West Clairmont High. Slim, trim, and the leader of the cheer leaders Jen is used to having her way. One day she tangles with a gypsy and is cursed. Can she overcome it or will her life be forever changed.
